required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CAR-T Cells in Treating Patients With Relapsed or Refractory NHL
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Uncontrolled, Multicenter Clinical Trial to Explore the Safety, Efficacy, and Remission Phase of Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell (CAR-T) in the Treatment of Relapsed Refractory (R/R) Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL)

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open, single-arm, phase I clinical study to evaluate efficacy and safety of chimeric antigen receptor T cell immunotherapy (CAR-T) in the treatment of Non-hodgkin's lymphoma. A total of 100 patients are planned to be enrolled over a period of 3 years.

detailed_description.textblock: Chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-modified T cells targeted against CD19 have demonstrated unprecedented successes in treating patients with hematopoietic and lymphoid malignancies. In this study, investigators will evaluate their safety and efficacy in patients with different types of hematopoietic and lymphoid malignancies. The primary goal is safety assessment including cytokine storm response and any other adverse effects. In addition, tumor targeting and disease status after treatment will also be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Severe/Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Severe/Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety
Copies numbers of CAR in peripheral blood(PB) and/or bone marrow(BM)

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate of complete remission and partial remission
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate of complete remission and partial remission

arm_group.description: The patient voluntarily signs the informed consent, and the patient meets the entry criteria to diagnose patients with Relapsed Refractory (R/R) non-Hodgkin lymphoma

intervention.description: CD19 CAR-T for CD19 positive R/R non-Hodgkin lymphoma
CD22 CAR-T for CD22 positive R/R non-Hodgkin lymphoma
CD19+CD22 CAR-T for CD19 positive and CD22 positive R/R non-Hodgkin lymphoma

overall_official.affiliation: The Second Hospital of Hebei Medical University

facility.name: No.2 Hospital of Hebei Medical University
